meanings.definition: A person who introduces or adopts new methods, ideas, or styles.
meanings.sent1: The modernizer brought innovative technology to the company.
meanings.sent2: She is known as a modernizer in the field of architecture.
meanings.sent3: The modernizer decided to shake things up by implementing a new strategy.
meanings.sent4: As a modernizer, he was a breath of fresh air in the traditional industry.
meanings.sent5: The modernizer's vision transformed the outdated system into a cutting-edge model.

meanings.definition: To make modern in appearance or style.
meanings.sent1: They modernized the old building by adding sleek glass facades.
meanings.sent2: She modernized her wardrobe by incorporating trendy accessories.
meanings.sent3: The interior designer modernized the living room with a minimalist approach.
meanings.sent4: His innovative designs modernized the fashion industry.
meanings.sent5: The renovation project aimed to modernize the entire neighborhood, starting with the park.

meanings.definition: The act of modernizing or the state of being modernized.
meanings.sent1: The modernizer of the city's infrastructure improved transportation for all.
meanings.sent2: Modernizer of the healthcare system led to better access to medical services.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the title of the best modernizer was fierce among the architects.
meanings.sent4: The rapid modernizer of technology left some people feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent5: The government's modernizer of policies aimed to streamline bureaucratic processes.
